snippet: Former Prime Minister John Major testified on Tuesday about a long run of Conservative rule that ended in painful defeat when Tony Blair came to power with Rupert Murdoch’s endorsement.
abstract: Former British Prime Min John Major testifies that Rupert Murdoch withdrew his newspapers' support for the Conservative party after Major refused a demand for changes in his policies on Europe; assertion offers some clue to the extent of Murdoch's perceived influence on British public life, a crucial issue under scrutiny by official inquiry into the News Corp phone hacking scandal.
lead_paragraph: Former Prime Minister John Major testified on Tuesday about a long run of Conservative rule that ended in painful defeat when Tony Blair came to power with Rupert Murdoch’s endorsement.

headline.seo: John Major Says Murdoch Sought Policy Changes
headline.main: British Ex-Premier Says Murdoch Press ‘Lowered Tone’
headline.print_headline: Ex-Premier Tells of Pressure by Murdoch
